text: the moment you walk into Sun NATO we
take pride in our facility it's bright
the lights are bright we try to keep it
as clean as possible but you'll see this
big big equipment which we've imported
from Japan and we try to use that
equipment to create noodle that's
developed in Japan my name is Ken
Shiraki I'm the general manager at Sun
noodle we consider ourselves purveyors
of tailor-made noodles and that might
sound really crazy but uh when my father
started company 30 years ago whether
you're a chef or a restaurant looking
for noodles what was available then
where maybe one or two types of noodles
it was my father's mission to really
work with the chef's to you to create a
noodle that matches the soup so after we
age the dough and we'll run it through
our line which compound presses it
gradually and that's very important for
ramen noodles to keep its texture not
compound pressure at one time but
gradually so that the gluten is still
there it's a its compound slowly from
there we'll cut it into different
thicknesses we'll make it wavy you'll
make it straight I will package it
either individually or as a bulk we've
been really lucky to have teamed up with
chika Toshi Nakamura who is the director
of ramen lab it's a place where chefs
can come in to learn how to make soup to
learn how to pair toppings and noodles
and so we've built that here in New York
that's something we always feel that
it's our goal to educate more people
them and so we want to be had a
game-changer the leader in this industry
